channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Return Draws 6.2 Million Viewers, Ratings Show
item.description: The first episode of “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” since it was suspended last week by Disney attracted nearly four times its average viewership.

item.title: Trump Administration Eyes More Mass Layoffs if Government Shuts Down
item.description: The president’s top aides told agencies to prepare for potential firings if Congress cannot extend funding before the end of Sept. 30.

item.title: For the first time in nearly 6 decades, a Syrian president steps up to speak at the U.N.

item.title: With His Pivot on Ukraine, Trump May Be Washing His Hands of the War
item.description: President Trump has shown dwindling interest in mediating a peace accord, joining European “security guarantees” for Ukraine or providing aid and inte...

item.title: White House threatens layoffs -- not furloughs -- if the government shuts down
item.description: In past government shutdowns, workers have been put on temporary furloughs until funding resumes. This time, the Trump White House is looking for bigg...

item.title: At a Times Event, Opposing Views on Climate Change Collide
item.description: In a day of live journalism, California’s governor assailed President Trump, and the U.S. energy secretary called for countries to quit the Paris Agre...

item.title: Kashmir’s Apple Harvest Rots After Landslide Blocks Road
item.description: The Himalayan region supplies most of India’s apples. But when heavy rains left a major highway blocked for weeks, farmers couldn’t get them to market...

item.title: 3 Strong Earthquakes Strike Venezuela
item.description: The quakes occurred within about five hours and shook cities in Venezuela and Colombia. There were no immediate reports of casualties.

item.title: China, for First Time, Vows to Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
item.description: President Xi Jinping told a U.N. climate conference that his country would seek to reduce emissions by at least 7 to 10 percent by 2035. Ukraine’s pre...

item.title: Map: 6.3-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Venezuela
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Syria’s President Makes His Debut on the World Stage
item.description: In his first U.N. address, Ahmed al-Shara, a former rebel, highlighted his efforts to rebuild Syria and its institutions.

item.title: A statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands in D.C. is removed as fast as it appeared
item.description: The statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands mid-frolic wasn't the first anti-Trump artwork on the National Mall in recent months. But it was the fir...

item.title: As AI advances, doomers warn the superintelligence apocalypse is nigh
item.description: AI is advancing fast, and AI doomers say humanity is at risk.

item.title: Victim's widow files the first lawsuit after January's D.C.-area midair crash
